page.title: 10St.John's Church,Yeovil.
page.content: In 1980 the church celebrated it's 600th birthday.Many local businesses gave tapestry pew cushions,some woven by local people,the designs showing who gave them.e.g.a helicopter stands for Westlands.The wool used came from the Wilton Carpet Co,because it is hardwearing,mothproof and the colours won't fade. About 140 people go to the Sunday services and the number is increasing.There are around 23 organisations connected with the church like the Sunday School, Brownies,Crusaders,Youth Fellowship, Mothers Union & so on. A recent appeal to restore the church raised Â£100,000,but they need more to repair the roof.The near- by school rooms were renovated this year and turned into a Hairdressers,a cakeshop and a giftshop.
